revision.text:
{{for|the 2011 film|Soul Surfer (film)}} {{for|the 2002 [[Ricky Fanté]] album|Soul Surfers}} A '''soul surfer''' (coined in the 1960s) is a [[surfing|surfer]] who surfs for the sheer pleasure of surfing. Although they may still enter in competitions, winning is not the soul surfer's main motive, since they scorn the commercialization of surfing. The term denotes a [[spirituality]] of surfing. As Brad Melekian put it in a 2005 article in ''[[Surfer (magazine)|Surfer]]'' magazine:
to pursue surfing not just as an athletic endeavor or as a sunny day diversion, but to try to glean whatever lessons you can from the practice. It means being aware of your surroundings, and respectful of the people and places that you interact with. It means being patient, mindful, kind, compassionate, understanding, active, thoughtful, faithful, hopeful, gracious, disciplined and...good.Melekian, Brad. March 2005, "Is God a Goofyfoot?", ''Surfer'', 46/3, p. 115.
The term originates from a 1963 surf instrumental of the same name. ==History== The first published mention of the term was in the 1963 surf guitar instrumental "Soul Surfer", by the [[Southern California]] [[Surf music|surf guitarist]] Johnny Fortune. The song was intended to reference the then-current [[soul music]] genre. The term "soul surfing" gained popularity in the late '60s, with the phrase most used in the mid- and late-'70s.[http://www.surfline.com/community/whoknows/whoknows.cfm?id=1114 Surfline | Who the F&*K Knows] In 1969 theologian Tom Blake penned an article entitled "Voice of the Wave", which examined the religious elements of surfing. By the early 70s, curious surfers began to experiment with various Eastern philosophies, such as [[yoga]] and meditation. The concept of the soul surfer was the main focus for the 1987 film ''[[North Shore (film)|North Shore]]'', where the lead character fails to win a major surf competition because someone cheated, yet, unfazed, shrugs his shoulders and remarks that “it doesn’t matter to a soul surfer”. This was also a concept expounded in the 1994 film ''[[The Endless Summer II]]'', a documentary which sees two talented surfers go around the world to emulate the original film, ''[[The Endless Summer]]''. More recently, the phrase was used as the title of a book about [[Bethany Hamilton]],Hamilton B (2004) Soul Surfer: A True Story of Faith, Family and Fighting to Get Back on the Board Simon & Schuster a young female surfer who continued to surf after her arm was bitten off by a [[tiger shark]]. The book was made into a 2011 feature film, also called ''[[Soul Surfer (film)|Soul Surfer]]''. Soul surfing has been described as “the highest level, the pinnacle of surfing spirituality equivalent to [[Nirvana]], [[Satori]], and [[buddhahood|total enlightenment]], but is rarely attained. The Soul Surfer expresses himself through his unity with the breaking wave. He borrows the wave's spirit for a short while and uses his body and equipment to translate the [[essence]] of the wave's spirit into Art”.Thomas Mitchell The Seven Levels of Surfers http://www.crowmountain.net/Surfing/sevenlevels.html ==See also== *[[Freeriding]] - a similar concept for snowboarding == References == {{Primary sources|date=November 2007}} {{reflist}} ==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20110527085628/http://bibledude.net/2011/05/the-real-soul-surfer-interview-with-rich-peluso/ the real soul surfer [an interview with rich peluso] ] at BibleDude.net [[Category:Surf culture]] [[Category:Spirituality]]

{{Infobox person | name = Susan Binau<!-- include middle initial, if not specified in birth_name --> | image = Susan binau.jpg | alt = <!-- descriptive text for use by the blind and visually impaired's speech synthesis (text-to-speech) software --> | caption = | birth_name = Susan Bøje Rasmussen<!-- only use if different from name --> | birth_date = 1964 <!-- {{Birth date and age|YYYY|MM|DD}} for living people - supply only the year unless the exact date is already widely published, as per WP:DOB. For people that have died, use {{Birth date|YYYY|MM|DD}}. --> | birth_place = Copenhagen, Denmark | death_date = <!-- {{Death date and age|YYYY|MM|DD|YYYY|MM|DD}} --> | death_place = | nationality = Danish | other_names = | occupation = [[Author]], [[businesswoman]], leadership development | years_active = | known_for =[[Entrepreneur]], [[Public Speaking]], [[Philanthropy]], [[Cancer Survivor]], [[Miss Universe Denmark]], [[Miss International 1985|Miss International Friendship]] | notable_works = }}
'''Susan Binau''' (née Bøje Rasmussen) born March 15, 1964 in [[Copenhagen]], [[Denmark]], is a global [[philanthropist]], published [[author]], [[motivational speaker]], [[Businessperson|businesswoman]], and [[cancer survivor]]. A past [[Miss Universe Denmark]] and [[Miss International 1985|Miss International Friendship]], Binau has since developed resources for families to use when coping with [[grief]] and the [[death]] or imminent death ([[hospice]] care) of a friend or family member.<ref name="Richter" /><ref name="Woman of Action">{{cite web |url=http://acelebrationofwomen.org/2012/07/woman-of-action-susan-binau/ |title= A Celebration of Women "Woman of Action (TM)": Susan Binau|author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=14 July 2012 |website= |publisher= |accessdate=25 October 2014}}</ref>
==Family and education== Binau and her sister Helle Bøje Holm, were born to mother Jytte Anna Christiansen and (late) father Peter Bøje Rasmussen. Binau is the mother to four children: Christina Binau Bonnor (born 1988), Malene Binau Bonnor (born 1991), Christian Binau Bonnor (born 1996) and Anders Frederik Binau (born 2004). She married investor and music producer Alan Binau in August 2004. The couple divorced in 2016.
Binau's education includes degrees from [[Roskilde University]], Master in Adult Education and Human Resource Development; [[Aarhus University|Danmarks Pædagogiske Universitet]], P.D. (Bachelor) Educational planner, and an Adult Teaching Degree (Aarhus Universitet Danmarks Lærerhøjskole). In addition, Binau completed marketing and leadership training through the Danish Bachelor of Commerce accreditation program, and holds a certification in cognitive behavioral and psychological testing: [[Myers-Briggs Type Indicator]], [[Jungian Type Index]], [[Meredith Belbin|Belbin]] [[Team Role Inventories|Self Perception Inventory]], and [[Occupational Personality Questionnaires]].{{citation needed|date=February 2015}}
==Awards and accolades== *USA 2014,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.napw.com/profile/11526424/Susan-Binau/ |title=Susan Binau |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date= |website= www.napw.com |publisher=National Association of Professional Women |accessdate=30 October 2014}}</ref> 2015:<ref>{{cite news |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |title=National Association of Professional Women Announces Susan Binau, M.A., B.A., Founder / President at Soul Care Group, LLC, a 2015 Professional Woman of the Year |url=http://www.virtual-strategy.com/2015/02/03/national-association-professional-women-announces-susan-binau-ma-ba-founder-president-sou#axzz3SV519pg6 |newspaper=virtual-strategy magazine |location=Garden City, NY |date=Feb 3, 2015 |access-date= Feb 22, 2015 }}</ref> [[National Association of Professional Women]] "Woman of the year" *Canada 2012: Honored as a WOMAN OF ACTION and 'alumna of The World Hub for Women Leaders'<ref name="Woman of Action" /> By A Celebration of Women,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://acelebrationofwomen.org/ |title=A Celebration of Women, Global Advocacy for Women Leaders |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=2014 |website= acelebrationofwomen.org |publisher= |accessdate=25 October 2014}}</ref> Canada. *Denmark 2009: Business Award. Danish Minister of Education, [[Inger Stojberg]], awarded the inaugural [[North Zealand]] Business Award to Binau’s Company (Vfactor A/S) in recognition of the company's progressive leadership programs for women<ref>{{cite news |last=Timm |first=Morten |date=27 November 2009 |title=Hørsholmfirma hædret med ny erhvervspris: Vfactors to stiftere, Charlotte Pedersen og Susan Binau, fik overrakt den første 'Nordsjællands Erhvervspris 2009' af beskæftigelses- og ligestillingsminister Inger Støjberg |trans-title=Hørsholm Company honored with new business award: Vfactors two founders, Charlotte Pedersen and Susan Binau, were presented with the first 'North Zealand Business Award' for Employment and Equal Opportunities by Inger Støjberg |url=http://hoersholm.lokalavisen.dk/hoersholmfirma-haedret-med-ny-erhvervspris%20/20091127/artikler/711279807 |language=Danish |newspaper=Ugebladet -en del af lokalavisen.dk |location=Denmark |accessdate=25 October 2014}}</ref> *[[Miss Universe Denmark]], 1985<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.missandmisterofdenmark.com/skoenhedskonkurrencer/tidligere-miss-danmark-vindere-/ |title=Historical List of Miss Denmark Winners of All Time |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date= |website=Mr & Miss Denmark |publisher= |accessdate=25 October 2014}}</ref> *[[Miss International 1985#Special awards|Miss Friendship]], at the 25th International Pageant (Japan, 15 September 1985)
==Angels Package== As a result of a [[cancer]] diagnosis in October 2006, Binau began to consider other ways that she could put her experience and energy to work to help families of seriously ill patients.<ref>{{cite news |last=Kristensen |first=Pernille |date=16 April 2009 |title=Ny bog gør op med dødens tabu |trans-title=New Book Confronts Death Taboo |url=http://gentofte.lokalavisen.dk/ny-bog-goer-op-med-doedens-tabu-/20090416/artikler/91877727/1226 |language=Danish |newspaper=Villabyerne -en dal aflokalavisen.dk |location=Denmark |accessdate=25 October 2014 }}</ref> She had envisioned how "easy", simple and important it would be to create a "hands on tool" that hospital staff could distribute to terminally ill patients and their loved ones. That vision became a reality when she developed the Angels Package.<ref>{{cite news |last=Nyheder |first= DN|date= 22 February 2013|title=Ny hjælpepakke skal sikre mere plads til patienter |trans-title= New Rescue Package|url=http://article.wn.com/view/2013/02/22/Ny_hj_lpepakke_skal_sikre_mere_plads_til_patienter/ |language=Danish |newspaper=World News Network (wn.com) |location=Denmark |accessdate=25 October 2014 }}</ref>
When this project began, Binau did not have a budget to work with; she spray painted the first angels in her garage in Florida, then brought the first prototypes with her in a suitcase to Denmark.{{citation needed|reason=|date=October 2014}} At this time, her father was dying and Binau arrived just in time to say goodbye. As the first recipient of an Angel Package, he was surrounded by angels and calming music from [[MusiCure]] when he died. This loss taught Binau some important lessons that she later described in the national Danish [[newspaper]] ''[[Søndagsavisen]]''.<ref>{{cite news |last=Nielsen |first=Thomas |date=21 June 2013 |title=Jeg hviskede, at han skulle give slip |trans-title=I whispered that he should let go |url=http://sondagsavisen.dk/2013/25/jeg-hviskede-at-han-skulle-give-slip.aspx |language=Danish |newspaper=[[Søndagsavisen]] |location=Denmark |accessdate=25 October 2014 }}</ref> The life lessons learned through this difficult time were integral to the development of Binau's short publication "Dignity in the final hours" (Vaerdighed I sidste stund).<ref name=dignity>{{cite book |last=Binau|first=Susan |date= |title=Dignity in the final hours (English edition)|url=http://susanbinau.com/media/dignitynewest.pdf |location=Denmark |publisher= |isbn= |accessdate=25 October 2014 }}</ref>
==Building awareness== In the following years, Binau embraced a role as "the voice of the families and children", advocating and participating as much as possible in the media, and on national television<ref>{{cite video |people=Binau, Susan (interviewee) |date= 6 June 2011 |title=Angel Kit |url=http://www.tv2lorry.dk/artikel/58960 |format=video |medium=video, television news interview |publisher= |location=Denmark |accessdate=25 October 2014 }}</ref> and [[DR (broadcaster)|radio]]<ref name="taboo2">{{cite AV media |people=Binau, Susan; Binau, Alan; Anderson, Grethe (interviewees) |year=2009 |title=Sygdommens og sorgens sprog Tro og eksistens |trans-title=The language of disease & sorrow. Faith & existence. |medium=audio |language=Danish |url=http://www.dr.dk/arkivP1/Troogeksistens/Udsendelser/2009/12/03152753.htm |accessdate= 25 October 2014 |time= |location=Denmark |publisher= [[DR (broadcaster)]] }}</ref> to build awareness about the needs and challenges of families facing terminal or serious illness.<ref name="till sickness">{{cite news |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.-->|date= 23 September 2009 |title=Kræft tvang par ud i kamp for kærligheden |trans-title= Cancer forced the family to battle for love |url=http://jyllands-posten.dk/livsstil/ECE4180561/kraeft-tvang-par-ud-i-kamp-for-kaerligheden/ |language= |newspaper=[[Jyllands-Posten]] |location=Denmark |accessdate= 26 October 2014}}</ref><ref name="till sickness2" />
After facing serious illness in their own relationship and understanding that sharing their own experience may help other couples with the difficult challenges encountered during the illness of a partner, Binau and her husband Alan Binau co-authored the book ''Till Sickness Do Us Part - How Love Survives in Difficult Times'', published by [[:da:Gads Forlag|Gads Forlag]].<ref name="till sickness" /><ref name="till sickness2">{{cite news |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=20 September 2009 |title=Parforholdet skranter, når den ene bliver syg |trans-title= Relationships can suffer when a spouse becomes ill |url=http://politiken.dk/forbrugogliv/livsstil/familieliv/ECE790948/parforholdet-skranter-naar-den-ene-bliver-syg/|language=Danish |newspaper=[[Politiken]] |location= Denmark |accessdate= 26 October 2014 }}</ref>
Addressing the difficult topics of illness, death and dying in her books<ref name="till sickness" /> was a way to create awareness of harmful cultural [[taboo]]s.<ref name="taboo2" /> Sharing her own experiences and the experiences of her family opened much needed community and international dialog on this topic, ultimately leading to speaking engagements throughout Denmark and beyond. Through these engagements, Binau speaks to patients, patient families, and healthcare professionals to provide motivation, inspiration, and guidance.
==Cancer survivor and entrepreneur== During chemotherapy Binau co-founded the company Vfactor A/S with Charlotte Alexandra Pedersen.<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.jobindex.dk/cms/stor_lykke_at_vaagne_om_morgenen_charlotte_alexandra_pedersen|title= Stor lykke at vågne om morgenen - Charlotte Alexandra Pedersen|author=Blankholm, Ulle Oppermann |date=2013-03-01 |website=www.jobindex.dk |publisher=JobIndex A/S |accessdate=25 October 2014}}</ref> This was something that Binau and Pederson had planned and discussed for a long time, and they persisted in this work and vision despite the challenges presented by Binau's chemotherapy treatments and recovery from surgery.<ref name="Richter" />
Binau is credited with developing new educational concepts including "Value Academy" and "Charter Academy", and building a strong mentor network of CEOs of some of the most prominent Danish companies.<ref>{{cite news |last=Bucchave |first=Gerd |date=14 January 2009 |title=Første lederuddannelse for kvinder |trans-title=The First Leadership Training For Women |url=http://borsen.dk/nyheder/karriere/artikel/1/148855/foerste_lederuddannelse_for_kvinder.html |language=Danish |newspaper=Borsen.dk |location=Denmark|accessdate=25 October 2014 }}</ref> Within the first couple of years, the client-base and vast network of Vfactor A/S had grown to include some of Denmark's largest corporations including AP Møller [[Mærsk]] and [[Microsoft]].<ref> {{cite web | url =http://www.byens-netvaerk.dk/Files/Billeder/Nyheder/2009/Kvinder%20i%20ledelse%20januar%202009,0512.pdf | title =Kvindelige ledere = balance = vækst. Hvordan kan man få flere kvindelige ledere? | trans-title="Female Leaders = Balance = Growth. How can we develop more female leaders?" | last = | first = | date = 20 January 2009 | website = cbaf.dk | publisher = cbaf.dk | accessdate =27 October 2014 }}</ref> The company also established successful collaborations with notable politicians.<ref> {{cite news |last=Forstholm |first=Iben |date=7 December 2010 |title=Skatteminister besøgte en af virkelighedens helte |trans-title=Taxation minister visited one of the real heroes (Vfactor A/S) |url=http://lokalavisen.dk/skatteminister-besoegte-en-af-virkelighedens-helte-/20101207/artikler/712079353/1865 |language=Danish |newspaper=Lokalavisen.dk |location= Denmark|accessdate=27 October 2014 }}</ref>
==Advocate== In 2009 Binau made the decision to fully focus on being an advocate for families dealing with terminal illness.{{citation needed|reason=|date=October 2014}} In an article written by Amy Patt, Binau emphasized how important it is to share experiences with like-minded people (patients, families, and friends) in order to avoid loneliness and isolation.<ref name="Patt">{{cite news |last=Patt |first=Amy |date=20 August 2013 |title=EXCLUSIVE INTERVIEW WITH SUSAN BINAU, FOUNDER, ANGEL CARE FAMILY FOUNDATION |url=http://www.cbpmag.com/exclusive-interview-with-susan-binau-founder-angel-care-family-foundation/ |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130823222508/http://www.cbpmag.com/exclusive-interview-with-susan-binau-founder-angel-care-family-foundation/ |dead-url=yes |archive-date=23 August 2013 |newspaper=CBP International Magazine |location= |accessdate=27 October 2014 |df= }}</ref> This concept was the driving motivator behind Binau's success in founding charities on two continents while working with minimal financial resources.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mypresswire.com/dk/pressroom/20741/pressrelease/49531 |title=Døden er det sidste tabu [Death is the last taboo] |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date= 19 May 2011|website= |publisher=Angel Kit Foundation |accessdate=25 October 2014}}</ref>
==Charities for families== In 2011 Binau founded the Danish charity Landsforeningen Støtte før Afskeden,<ref name=charity /> together with composer [[Niels Eje]].<ref>{{cite news |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=5 July 2011 |title=Ny landsforening: Dø med værdighed |trans-title= New National Association: Dying with dignity |url= http://hoersholm.lokalavisen.dk/ny-landsforening-doe-med-vaerdighed-/20110705/artikler/707059667/1039|language= Danish|newspaper= Ugebladet -en del af lokalavisen.dk |location= Denmark|accessdate= 25 October 2014}}</ref> The [[MusiCure]] CD sampler included in the patient donation package is an important component. The music consists of [[soundscape]]s which use a scientifically based method to induce calm and soothing therapeutic effects in listeners.<ref name="NilssonUlrica2009">{{cite journal |last1=Nilsson |first1=Ulrica |title=The effect of music intervention in stress response to cardiac surgery in a randomized clinical trial |journal=Heart & Lung: the Journal of Acute and Critical Care |volume=38 |issue=3 |pages=201–7 |year=2009 |pmid=19486788 |doi=10.1016/j.hrtlng.2008.07.008}}</ref><ref name="NilssonStefan2009">{{cite journal |last1=Nilsson |first1=Stefan |last2=Kokinsky |first2=Eva |last3=Nilsson |first3=Ulrica |last4=Sidenvall |first4=Birgitta |last5=Enskär |first5=Karin |title=School-aged children's experiences of postoperative music medicine on pain, distress, and anxiety |journal=Pediatric Anesthesia |volume=19 |issue=12 |pages=1184–90 |year=2009 |pmid=19863741 |doi=10.1111/j.1460-9592.2009.03180.x}}</ref><ref name="Weeks2010">{{cite journal |last1=Weeks |first1=Birgit P. |last2=Nilsson |first2=Ulrica |title=Music interventions in patients during coronary angiographic procedures: A randomized controlled study of the effect on patients' anxiety and well-being |journal=European Journal of Cardiovascular Nursing |year=2010 |doi=10.1016/j.ejcnurse.2010.07.002}}</ref><ref name="NilssonUlrica22009">{{cite journal |last1=Nilsson |first1=Ulrica |title=Soothing music can increase oxytocin levels during bed rest after open-heart surgery: a randomised control trial |journal=Journal of Clinical Nursing |volume=18 |issue=15 |pages=2153–61 |year=2009 |pmid=19583647 |doi=10.1111/j.1365-2702.2008.02718.x}}</ref><ref name="NilssonUlrica32009">{{cite journal |last1=Nilsson |first1=Ulrica |last2=Lindell |first2=Lena |last3=Eriksson |first3=Annika |last4=Kellerth |first4=Thomas |title=The effect of music intervention in relation to gender during coronary angiographic procedures: A randomized clinical trial |journal=European Journal of Cardiovascular Nursing |volume=8 |issue=3 |pages=200–6 |year=2009 |pmid=19186107 |doi=10.1016/j.ejcnurse.2009.01.001}}</ref><ref name="FredrikssonAnn-Charlotte2009">{{cite journal |last1=Fredriksson |first1=Ann-Charlotte |last2=Hellström |first2=Leif |last3=Nilsson |first3=Ulrica |title=Patients’ perception of music versus ordinary sound in a postanaesthesia care unit: A randomised crossover trial |journal=Intensive and Critical Care Nursing |volume=25 |issue=4 |pages=208–13 |year=2009 |pmid=19446459 |doi=10.1016/j.iccn.2009.04.002}}</ref>
Also in 2011, Binau founded USA-based AngelKIT Foundation.<ref>{{citation |url=http://www.angelkit.org/ |title=AngelKIT main page |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120115082835/http://www.angelkit.org/ |archivedate=15 January 2012 |accessdate=11 November 2014 }}</ref>
Previously, Binau founded and managed another charity, the Female Courage Foundation.<ref name="Richter" />
==Kids helping kids== In 2013, Binau's nine-year-old son Andy (Anders) handed her a book called ''Max the Super Dog's Pet Shop Adventures''.<ref>{{cite news |last=Ramlow |first=Lars Sandager |date=20 October 2014 |title=Ni-årig bag bog til børn der mister |trans-title= 9 -year-old Anders writes book to help other children|url=http://hoersholm.lokalavisen.dk/9-aarige-anders-skriver-bog-for-at-hjaelpe-andre-boern-/Lokale-nyheder/20141029/artikler/710299879/1039 |language=Danish |newspaper=Ugebladet - en del af lakalavisen.dk |location=Denmark |accessdate=30 October 2014 }}</ref> Andy said that he wanted to give his mother a helping hand: "My mother had created a book about cancer for the adults in the hospitals. So I thought that there was a lack of a book for children, who must lose one they care about, and then I started to do it."<ref name="nov2014">{{cite news |last=Restrup |first=Anne Katrine |date=8 November 2014 |title=Jeg syntes, at der manglede en bog til børnene om kræft |trans-title=I thought that there was a lack of a book for children about cancer |url=http://www.kristeligt-dagblad.dk/familieliv/2014-11-08/%E2%80%9Djeg-syntes-der-manglede-en-bog-til-b%C3%B8rnene-om-kr%C3%A6ft%E2%80%9D |language=Danish |newspaper=[[Kristeligt Dagblad]] |location=Copenhagen, Denmark|accessdate=10 November 2014 }}</ref> This booklet, about a 'superpup', was created as an activity book to be given as a gift for hospitalized children. It later became an important part of a donation program, the AngelKID Heart Package (HJERTEPAKKE package),<ref>{{cite web |url= http://stfa.dk/hjertepakken-til-born/ |title=Hjertepakke-donation til børn |trans-title=AngelKID Heart Package Donation for Children |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=11 June 2014 |website= |publisher= |accessdate=25 October 2014}}</ref> for children who have a [[Terminal illness|terminally ill]] relative.
The AngelKID package program was launched through the Danish Charity founded by Binau, Landsforeningen Støtte Før Afskeden (National Association for Support Before Parting).<ref name=charity>{{cite web |url= http://stfa.dk/|title=Landsforeningen Støtte Før Afskeden |trans-title=National Association for Support Before Parting |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=2014 |website= |publisher= |accessdate=25 October 2014}}</ref> The launch was publicized during a national bus campaign and on national television,<ref>{{cite AV media |people=Susan Binau |year=2014 |title=Go morgen Danmark: En sakaldt hjertepakke skau nu hjaelpe born med doende foraeldre |trans-title=Good Morning Denmark: Heart Packages are helping children of dying parents |medium=video |language=Danish |url=http://play.tv2.dk/programmer/nyheder-debat/magasiner/go-morgen-danmark/17-juni-2014-1-84367/ |accessdate=11 November 2014 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140708210422/http://play.tv2.dk/programmer/nyheder-debat/magasiner/go-morgen-danmark/17-juni-2014-2-84368/ |archivedate=8 July 2014 |format=video |time= |location=Denmark |publisher= |id= |isbn= |oclc= |quote= |ref= }}</ref> with Ambassador Cecilie Lind (age 25) and her sister Fiona (age 9), sisters who lost their mother in 2012 after a short battle with [[cancer]]. The book ''Max the Super Dog's Adventures'' and Heart Package Donations were further publicized by Susan and Andy Binau during a fall 2014 campaign in Denmark.<ref>{{cite news |last=Timm |first=Mortem |date=29 October 2014 |title=9-årige Anders skriver bog for at hjælpe andre børn |trans-title=9 -year-old Anders writes book to help other children |url=http://borsen.dk/nyheder/karriere/artikel/1/148855/foerste_lederuddannelse_for_kvinder.html |language=Danish |newspaper=Borsen.dk |location=Denmark|accessdate=25 October 2014 }}</ref>
Heart Packages (Hjertepakken, Danish) have been donated to over 1000 children.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://stfa.dk/juni-2014-stfa-uddeler-1000-hjertepakker/ |title=Juni 2014: STFA uddeler 1000 Hjertepakker |trans-title= June 2014: STFA donates 1000 Heart Packages |last=Hasen |first=Kamilla Thirstrup |date=19 June 2014 |location=Denmark |language= Danish |accessdate= 25 October 2014}}</ref>
The project received support from several large foundations including Harboefonden,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.harboefonden.dk|title=Harboefonden – En almen, social fond|website=www.harboefonden.dk|accessdate=25 September 2018}}</ref> Tømrerhandler Johannes Fog Fonden,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fogfond.dk|title=Fog Fonden|publisher=|accessdate=25 September 2018}}</ref> Fonden Brand af 1849],<ref>[http://firma.eniro.dk/f/brand-af-1848-fond:67230681/4180-sorø Fonden Brand af 1849]</ref> Møenbrogaard Fonden,<ref>[http://www.krak.dk/f/møenbogaardfonden:66930001/4800-nykøbing+f,%20mfl Møenbrogaard Fonden]</ref> and OLE KIRKS FOND,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.olekirksfond.dk/|title=Ole Kirks fond|website=www.olekirksfond.dk|accessdate=25 September 2018}}</ref> a Danish charity named after the founder of [[Lego]], [[Ole Kirk Christiansen|Ole Kirk]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://stfa.dk/ole-kirks-fond-stotter-med-50-000-kr-til-flere-hjertepakker/ |last=Hasen |first=Kamilla Thirstrup |date= 29 September 2014 |location=Denmark |language=Danish |title= Ole Kirks Fond støtter med 50.000 kr. til flere Hjertepakker|trans-title=Ole Kirk's Lego Foundation Supports 50,000 kr for more HeartPackages |accessdate=25 October 2014 }}</ref>
In 2012, Binau partnered with Danish Actor Christian Heldbo Wienborg<ref>{{cite AV media |people=Barfoed, Kasper (Director), Wienborg, Christian Heldbo (Actor) |year=2006|title=Tempelriddernes skat |trans-title=The Lost Treasure of the Knights Templar|medium=film |language=Danish |url= |time= |location=Denmark|publisher=M&M Productions |ASIN=B001HO7KU6}}</ref> to begin fundraising and production of an international television documentary program designed to demonstrate that discussing, understanding, preparing for, and coping with the death of loved ones is a natural part of life and should not be a cultural taboo.<ref>{{cite news |last= Timm |first= Morten |date=20 November 2012 |title=Skuespiller og forfatter bryder tabu om døden: Hørsholm-forfatter Susan Binau og skuespiller Christian Heldbo Wienborg, Hørsholm, går sammen om ny international dokumentarfilm |trans-title=Actress and author break the taboo of death: Author Susan Binau and Actor Christian Heldo Wienborg, Horsholm, unite to create a new international documentary |url=http://hoersholm.lokalavisen.dk/skuespiller-og-forfatter-bryder-tabu-om-doeden-/20121120/artikler/711209717/1039 |language=Danish |newspaper=Ugebladet - en del af lokalavisen.dk |location=Denmark |accessdate=25 October 2014 }}</ref>
==Speaking career== An experienced speaker, Binau has traveled internationally to share her personal and professional experiences and successes with patients, patient families, healthcare professionals, and other audiences around the globe.<ref>{{cite news |last=Legaard |first=Carsten |date=6 June 2011 |title=Susan Binau taler for frivillige: Susan Binau taler om mod, handlekraft og livspassion på Selmersbo den 8. juni |trans-title=Susan Binau speaks for volunteers: Susan Binau talking about courage, vigor and life passion on Selmersbo June 8 |url=http://hoersholm.lokalavisen.dk/susan-binau-taler-for-frivillige-/20110606/artikler/706059977/1039 |language=Danish |newspaper=Ugebladet - en del af lokalavisen.dk |location= |accessdate=25 October 2014 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url= http://onepridenetwork.wordpress.com/|title=Leaders in Innovative Marketing Strategies, Susan Binau presents "Desire to Inspire" |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=29 Sep 2013 |website=One Pride Network: Building Bridges Not Walls |publisher=JTL Productions |accessdate=25 October 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Bayer |first=Claus|date= 16 November 2010 |title=Temaaften om syg dom og samliv |trans-title=Theme night on ill judgment and cohabitation |url=http://www.e-pages.dk/unyt/160/30 |language=Danish |newspaper=Lokalavisen.dk |location=Denmark |accessdate=27 October 2014 }}</ref> Her time is split between homes in the USA and Europe.<ref name="Richter">{{cite news |last=Richter |first=Patricia |date=4 May 2010 |title=Velkommen til en verden uden grænser og begrænsninger! |trans-title=Welcome to a world without borders and limits ! |url=http://karrieremor.dk/2010/05/velkommen-til-en-verden-uden-gr%C3%A6nser-og-begr%C3%A6nsninger/ |language=Danish |newspaper=Karriere Mor |location= |accessdate= 30 October 2014 }}</ref>
==Author==
===Books===
Danish books: * ''Mor Må Jeg Få Din Pc, Hvis Du Dør?'' - Susan Binau, Alan Binau<ref>CeoNeo Books 2008</ref> * ''Til sygdom os skiller E-bog│Sådan overlever kærligheden, når det er svært''<ref>{{cite web|url=https://gad.dk/til-sygdom-os-skiller|title=Gads Forlag|website=gad.dk|accessdate=25 September 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last= |first= |date=9 Sep 2008 |title=Mor, må jeg få din pc, hvis du dør? |trans-title=Mummy, can I have your PC, if you die? |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |url= http://www.avisen.dk/mor-maa-jeg-faa-din-pc-hvis-du-doer_98009.aspx/ |newspaper=Avisen DK |location=Denmark |accessdate= 25 October 2014 }}</ref> * ''Mor, Mor må jeg få din pc, hvis du dør?- stemmer fra en sygdomsramt familie'' (2nd edition), Forlaget Indblik, 2012<ref>{{cite book |last=Binau |first=Susan |date=2012 |language= Danish |title= Mor, Mor må jeg få din pc, hvis du dør?- stemmer fra en sygdomsramt familie|location= |publisher=Forlaget Indblik |isbn= 978-87-92888-44-0}}</ref> * ''LØVEN OG MARGUERITRUTEN – FIND DIN NETVÆRKSSTIL. Find your networking style'', Ceoneo Books, 2008 <ref>{{cite web|url=https://inkthink.dk/boeger/find-din-netvaerksstil/|title=Find din netværksstil|date=15 May 2016|publisher=|accessdate=25 September 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Svendsen |first=Susanne |date=27 August 2008 |title=Velkommen i netværkshaven |trans-title=Welcome to the network garden |url= http://www.jyllands-posten.dk/protected/premium/erhverv/karriere/ECE4046822/velkommen-i-netvaerkshaven/ |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20140808065313/http://www.jyllands-posten.dk/protected/premium/erhverv/karriere/ECE4046822/velkommen-i-netvaerkshaven/ |dead-url= yes |archive-date= 8 August 2014 |newspaper=[[Jyllands-Posten]] |location=Denmark |accessdate= }}</ref><ref>{{cite book |last=Binau |first=Susan |date=2008 |title= Loven og Margutitruten-find din netvarksstil |trans-title=Find your networking style |url= |language=Danish|location= Denmark|publisher=CeoNeo Books |isbn=978-87-92348-01-2 |accessdate= }}</ref> * ''En værdig afsked - bogen om døden'', MD Klara Balling and Susan Binau. Morpho Publishing, 2009 <ref>{{cite book |last=Binau |first=Susan |last2=Balling |first2=Klara|date= 2009 |title= En vardig Afsked – bogen om doden|trans-title=A dignified passing |url= |language= Danish|location= Denmark|publisher=Morpho Publisher |isbn=978-87-993027-0-3 |accessdate= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://sn.dk/Holbaek/At-sige-verden-vaerdigt-farvel/artikel/304564|title=At sige verden værdigt farvel|date=13 April 2009|publisher=|accessdate=25 September 2018}}</ref>
The Caring Soul Series is a collection of three inspirational self-help books, which are based on true stories and focus on people dealing with challenging life experiences ranging from serious illness through death and grieving. * ''Mommy, Can I Call You In Heaven?: How we coped with cancer as a family''<ref>{{cite web|author=|url=https://www.amazon.com/Mommy-Can-Call-You-Heaven/dp/151930577X/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1504335696&sr=1-1&keywords=Mommy+susan+binau |title=Mommy, Can I Call You In Heaven?: How we coped with cancer as a family (The Caring Soul Series) (Volume 1): Susan Binau: 9781519305770: Amazon.com: Books |publisher=Amazon.com |date= |accessdate=2018-09-25}}</ref> * ''Till sickness do us part–how love survives difficult times'', Gads Forlag, 2009<ref>{{cite web |url=http://gad.dk/Til%20sygdom%20os%20skiller |title=Til sygdom os skiller |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date= |website=gad.dk |publisher=gads forlag |accessdate=27 October 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite book |last=Binau |first=Susan |last2=Binau |first2=Alan|date= 2009 |title= Til sygdom os skiller|trans-title=Till sickness do us part |url= |language= Danish|location= Denmark|publisher=Gads Forlag |isbn=978-87-12-04497-0|accessdate= }}</ref> * ''The Art of Dying - writing your own final chapter''<ref>{{cite web|author=|url=https://www.amazon.com/Art-Dying-Susan-Binau/dp/1518875750/ref=asap_bc?ie=UTF8 |title=The Art of Dying (Caring Soul Series): Susan Binau: 9781518875755: Amazon.com: Books |publisher=Amazon.com |date= |accessdate=2018-09-25}}</ref>
The books in the ''Super Dog Zam Grief'' series offer families with grieving children a self-help tool to use at home. The workbooks were developed specifically for three different age groups: 3-5, 6-8, and 9–12 years. The books were co-authored by Binau's youngest son, Andy Binau (creator of ''The Super Dog ZAM'' and author of ''My Doggy Diary''), and daughter, Malene Shak (a certified Montessori teacher).
* ''The Parent's Guide - how to support your grieving child''<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/Parents-Guide-Support-Grieving-Child/dp/1519242433/ref=la_B01GETDKIE_1_4?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1504334796&sr=1-4|title=The Parent's Guide: How to Support Your Grieving Child|first=search|last=results|date=22 January 2016|publisher=CreateSpace Independent Publishing Platform|accessdate=25 September 2018|via=Amazon}}</ref> * ''The Super Dog ZAM ages 3-5: A helping paw for grieving children''<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/Super-Dog-ZAM-ages-3-5/dp/1518800092/ref=asap_bc?ie=UTF8|title=The Super Dog ZAM ages 3-5: A helping paw for grieving children|first1=Andy Frederik|last1=Binau|first2=Malene|last2=Shak|first3=search|last3=results|date=29 October 2015|publisher=CreateSpace Independent Publishing Platform|accessdate=25 September 2018|via=Amazon}}</ref> * ''The Super Dog ZAM ages 6-8: a helping pal for grieving children''<ref>{{cite web|author=|url=https://www.amazon.com/Super-Dog-ZAM-ages-6-8/dp/1518800122/ref=sr_1_2?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1504334964&sr=1-2&keywords=The+Super+Dog+ZAM |title=The Super Dog ZAM ages 6-8: a helping pal for grieving children (Volume 4): Andy Frederik Binau: 9781518800122: Amazon.com: Books |publisher=Amazon.com |date= |accessdate=2018-09-25}}</ref> * ''The Super Dog ZAM ages 9-12: A companion for grieving children''<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/Super-Dog-ZAM-ages-9-12/dp/1518800084/ref=sr_1_3?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1504335041&sr=1-3&keywords=The+Super+Dog+ZAM|title=The Super Dog ZAM ages 9-12: A companion for grieving children|first1=Susan|last1=Binau|first2=Andy Frederik|last2=Binau|date=28 October 2015|publisher=CreateSpace Independent Publishing Platform|accessdate=25 September 2018|via=Amazon}}</ref>
===Other publications=== * ''A dignified passing - an inspirational booklet for relatives of a terminally ill or dying patient'', Landsforeningen Stoette for Afskeden, 2013<ref>{{cite web |url=https://bibliotek.dk/da/work/870970-basis%3A50702650 |title=Værdighed i sidste stund |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |website= bibliotek.dk |publisher= |location=Denmark |language=Danish |trans-title=Dignity in the final moment |accessdate= 2 November 2014 }}</ref>
==Community volunteer contributions== *Florida Hospital [[Hospice]] *Commissioned [[Stephen Ministries|Stephen Minister]], Presbyterian Church (Celebration, Florida)<ref name="CBC Annual Report">[http://commpres.net/sites/commpres.com/files/CommunityPresbyterianChurchAnnualReport2013.pdf],"Community Presbyterian Church in Celebration Annual Report", 2013</ref> *Community Hope Center serving the homeless of [[Osceola County, Florida|Osceola County]], Florida *Co-facilitator of a grief group for children, "Grief Healing for Kids", Presbyterian Church (Celebration, Florida)<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.commpres.com/sites/commpres.com/files/2014%20Community%20Presbyterian%20Church%20annual%20report.pdf |title=Community Presbyterian Church in Celebration Annual Report 2014 |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date= 2014 |website= www.commpres.com |publisher= |access-date=Feb 22, 2015}}</ref>
==External links== *[http://www.susanbinau.com Susan Binau (personal)] *[http://stfa.dk Landsforeningen Støtte før Afskeden] *[http://hope192.com Community Hope Center] of Osceola County, Florida *Florida Hospital [http://www.floridahospitalhospice.org Hospice Care], [[Stephen Ministries]] *[http://acelebrationofwomen.org/celebration-house/about-us/ A Celebration of Women] *[http://gad.dk/ Gads Forlag (publisher)] *[https://amazon.com/author/sbinau Author bio at Amazon]
==References== {{reflist|colwidth=30em}}
{{authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Binau, Susan}} [[Category:1964 births]] [[Category:Cancer survivors]] [[Category:Danish women writers]] [[Category:Family and parenting writers]] [[Category:Founders of charities]] [[Category:Danish women in business]] [[Category:Grief]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Miss International 1985 delegates]] [[Category:Miss Universe 1985 contestants]] [[Category:Motivational writers]] [[Category:Women motivational writers]]

{{Orphan|date=May 2015}}
{{Infobox book | name = The Living Cosmos: Our Search for Life in the Universe | title_orig = | translator = | image = The Living Cosmos.jpg | author = [[Chris Impey]] | cover_artist = | country = | language = | series = | subject = [[Astronomy]] | genre = [[Non-fiction]] | publisher = [[Random House]] | release_date = December 11, 2011 (paperback) | media_type = Print ([[Hardcover]] and [[paperback]]) and electronic ([[e-book]]) | pages = 393 | isbn = 978-0521173841 | preceded_by = | followed_by = [[How It Ends: From You to the Universe|How It Ends]] }} '''''The Living Cosmos: Our Search for Life in the Universe''''' is a [[non-fiction]] book by the [[astronomer]] [[Chris Impey]] that discusses the subject of [[astrobiology]] and efforts to discover life beyond [[Earth]]. It was published as a hardcover by [[Random House]] in 2007 and as a paperback by [[Cambridge University Press]] in 2011.
==Summary== The Living Cosmos is a [[non-fiction]] book by [[University of Arizona]] professor of [[astronomy]] [[Chris Impey]] on the status of [[astrobiology]]. It summarizes the state of research as scientists trying to address one of the most profound questions we can ask about nature: Is there [[life in the universe]] beyond the Earth? The author interviewed dozens of leading researchers,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cambridge.org/us/knowledge/isbn/item5600535/?site_locale=en_US|title=Talking About Life|publisher=[[Cambridge University Press]]|date=2013|accessdate=April 24, 2013}}</ref> and he includes material from the interviews and vignettes of the researchers in the book. The companion web site to the book contains articles and video clips on astrobiology produced by the author, as well as a glossary and links to other relevant sites.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thelivingcosmos.com|title=The Living Cosmos|author=Hardegree-Ullman, K. K.|author2=Impey, C. D.|last-author-amp=yes|date=2011|accessdate=April 24, 2013}}</ref>
The book begins with a review of the cosmic setting for life and reviews the insights of astronomy since [[Copernicus]]. The discovery that we live in a “biological universe” would be a continuation of the progression where there is nothing exceptional about the setting of the Earth and the events that have occurred on this planet.
Subsequent chapters consider the [[origin of life on Earth]], and the physical extremes to which life as adapted. In [[astrobiology]], it pays to think “outside the box” and imagine how strange life might be or whether post-[[biological evolution]] is possible, where the basis is mechanical or computational. A chapter on evolution shows how it is affected by the cosmic environment.
Possibilities of life in the [[Solar System]] are considered next, with emphasis on [[Mars]], [[Titan (moon)|Titan]], and outer [[moons]] harboring [[liquid water]]. Next is a summary of the rapidly changing state of play in the search for [[extrasolar planets]] or exoplanets. After centuries of speculation and decades of futile searching, planets around other stars were first discovered in 1995 and the number is now over 850, with several thousand more candidates from the [[Kepler mission]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://exoplanet.eu/|title=The Extrasolar Planets Encyclopaedia (Check here for an updated catalog of exoplanets)|author=Jean Schneider|date=2013|accessdate=April 24, 2013}}</ref> The book ends with the search for extraterrestrial intelligence ([[SETI]]) and the use of the [[Drake equation]] to frame discussions of cosmic companionship.
The web site for the book features images of a set of seven mixed media, boxed construction art pieces by Heather Green, commissioned specially for the book.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bio5.org/about/experience-bio5|title=Experience BIO5|publisher=[[Arizona Board of Regents]]|date=2013|accessdate=April 24, 2013}}</ref> The art is on permanent display in the BIO5 Institute at the University of Arizona.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cartagrafia.com|title=cartagrafia - projects|author=Heather Green|date=2013|accessdate=April 24, 2013}}</ref> An article on the collaboration between Heather Green and Chris Impey and the artistic and scientific themes of the work was published in the [[Leonardo Journal]] online.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.leonardo.info/isast/journal/toc435.html|title=Leonardo Journal|issue=5|volume=43|author=Ellen K. Levy|date=2010|accessdate=April 24, 2013}}</ref>
==Reception== The Living Cosmos was generally very well received. It received a starred review from [[Kirkus Reviews]], referring to the book as a “Lively, clear, and up-to-date overview of [[astronomy]], [[cosmology]], [[biology]], and [[evolution]], specifically as related to the search for [[extraterrestrial life]]”.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.kirkusreviews.com/book-reviews/chris-impey/the-living-cosmos/|title=The Living Cosmos by Chris Impey, Kirkus|author=Kirkus Review|date=2010|accessdate=April 24, 2013}}</ref> Popular magazine [[Entertainment Weekly]] gave the book a grade of B+, saying it was “not an easy read” but calling it a “live, elegant overview”.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ew.com/ew/article/0,,20163350,00.html|title=The Living Cosmos Review|author=Wook Kim|date=2007|accessdate=April 24, 2013}}</ref> It was reviewed by ''[[Nature (journal)|Nature]]'', ''[[Physics Today]]'', and ''[[New Scientist]]'', with the latter commenting on occasional digressions, but declaring the book “beautifully written”.<ref>{{cite web|url= https://www.newscientist.com/article/mg19626353.300-review-ithe-living-cosmos-by-chris-impey.html|title=Review: The Living Cosmos by Chris Impey|author=Lewis Dartnell|date=2007|accessdate=April 24, 2013}}</ref> Reader reviews are 85% five stars on [[Amazon.com|Amazon]] and over 90% like the book on [[Goodreads]]. The 2011 paperback edition has updates to help keep up with the accelerating pace of [[exoplanet]] discovery.
==Notes== {{reflist}}
==External links== * {{Official website|http://thelivingcosmos.com}} * [http://www.cambridge.org/us/knowledge/isbn/item6049624/?site_locale=en_US Cambridge University Press] * [https://www.amazon.com/Chris-Impey/e/B001IZXGTS Amazon Author Page] * [http://chrisimpey.com Chris Impey's Website]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Living Cosmos, The}} [[Category:2011 books]] [[Category:Books by Chris Impey]] [[Category:Astronomy books]] [[Category:Astrobiology]] [[Category:British non-fiction books]]

revision.text:
{{Other uses|Unknown Soldier (disambiguation)}} [[File:Памятник на могиле Неизвестного солдата Москва 0010 01.JPG|thumb|The [[Tomb of the Unknown Soldier (Moscow)|Tomb of the Unknown Soldier, Moscow]]]] The '''Tomb of the Unknown Soldier''' refers to a monument dedicated to the services of an unknown soldier and to the common memories of all soldiers killed in any war. Such tombs can be found in many nations and are usually high-profile [[national monument]]s. Throughout history, many soldiers have died in war with their remains being unidentified. Following [[World War I]], a movement arose to commemorate these soldiers with a single [[tomb]], containing the body of one such unidentified soldier. It is a tomb for unknown people.
== History == === France and the United Kingdom === During the First World War, the British and French armies who were allies during the war jointly decided to bury soldiers themselves. In the UK, under the Imperial War Graves Commission (now [[Commonwealth War Graves Commission]]), the Reverend [[David Railton]] had seen a grave marked by a rough cross while serving in the [[British Army]] as a [[Military chaplain|chaplain]] on the [[Western Front (World War I)|Western Front]], which bore the pencil-written legend "An Unknown British Soldier".<ref name="Memorial">Henry Allingham, Dennis Goodwin (2011). "Kitchener's Last Volunteer: The Life of Henry Allingham, the Oldest Surviving Veteran of the Great War". p. 132. Random House, 1976</ref> He suggested (together with the French in their own country) the creation at a national level of a symbolic funeral and burial of an "Unknown Warrior", proposing that the grave should in the UK include a national monument in the form of what is usually, but not in this particular case, a headstone. The idea received the support of the [[Dean of Westminster]], Prime Minister [[David Lloyd George]], and later from King [[George V of the United Kingdom|George V]], responding to a wave of public support.<ref name="Memorial" /> At the same time, a similar concern grew in France. In November 1916, a local officer of [[Le Souvenir français]] proposed the idea of burying "an ignored soldier" in the [[Panthéon]]. A formal bill was presented in Parliament in November 1918. The decision was voted into law on September 1919.<ref>{{fr}} Jean-Yves Le Naour, ''Le soldat inconnu : la guerre, la mort, la mémoire'', Gallimard, 2008, p. 20</ref>
The United Kingdom and France conducted services connected with their 'monumental' graves (as presumably newly conceived, and in any case approved, by their respective armies) on [[Armistice Day]] 1920 (the burial itself taking place later in January of the following year in France). In the UK, the [[Tomb of the Unknown Warrior]] was created at [[Westminster Abbey]], while in France ''[[Tomb of the Unknown Soldier (France)|La tombe du soldat inconnu]]'' was placed in the Arc de Triomphe.
=== Other countries === The idea of a symbolic Tomb of the Unknown Soldier then spread to other countries. In 1921, the [[United States]] unveiled its own [[Tomb of the Unknown Soldier (Arlington)|Tomb of the Unknown Soldier]], Portugal its [[Tomb of the Unknown Soldier (Portugal)|Túmulo do Soldado Desconhecido]], and Italy its [[Altare della Patria#Unknown soldier|La tomba del Milite Ignoto]]. Other nations have followed the practice and created their own tombs.
In Chile and Ukraine, second 'unknown tombs' were unveiled to commemorate ''The Unknown Sailor''.
== Symbolism == The Tombs of the Unknown Soldiers typically contain the remains of a dead soldier who is unidentified (or "known but to God" as the stone is sometimes inscribed).<ref>{{cite book |last=Kwon |first=Heonik |title=Ghosts of War in Vietnam |year=2008 |publisher=Cambridge University Press |isbn=0-521-88061-0 |page=46}}</ref> These remains are considered impossible to be identified, and so serve as a symbol for all of a country's unknown dead wherever they fell in the war being remembered. The anonymity of the entombed soldier is the key symbolism of the monument; it could be the tomb of anyone who fell in service of the nation, and therefore serves as a monument symbolizing all of the sacrifices.
== Examples == Tombs of the Unknown Soldiers from around the world and various wars include the following: {| class="wikitable" |- ! width=16% | Countries ! width=21% | Location ! Image ! Description |- | {{flag|Argentina}} | [[Buenos Aires Metropolitan Cathedral|Metropolitan Cathedral]] in [[Buenos Aires]] | [[File:Facade BA Metropolitan Church.jpg|100px]] | Tomb of the Unknown Soldier of the Independence |- | {{flag|Australia}} | [[Australian War Memorial]] in [[Canberra]] | [[File:Tomb of the Unknown Soldier (Australia).jpg|100px]] | The tomb of the Unknown Australian Soldier at the Australian War Memorial in Canberra. |- | {{flag|Austria}} | ''Outer Palace Gate'' at the [[Heldenplatz]] in [[Vienna]] | [[File:Äußeres Burgtor (13761) IMG 0413.jpg|100px]] | {{Citation needed|date=February 2011}} |- | rowspan=2 | {{flag|Bangladesh}} | [[Jatiyo Smriti Soudho]] in [[Savar Upazila]] | [[File:Sriti shoud.jpeg|100px]] | Jatiyo Sriti Shoudho (Bengali: জাতীয় স্মৃতি সৌধ Jatio Sriti Shoudho) or National Martyrs' Memorial is the national monument of Bangladesh is the symbol in the memory of the valour and the sacrifice of all those who gave their lives in the Bangladesh Liberation War of 1971, many of whom were buried in mass graves in that park.The monument is located in Savar, about 35 km north-west of the capital, Dhaka. It was designed by [[Syed Mainul Hossain]]. |- | [[Shikha Onirban or 'Eternal Flame']] in [[Dhaka]] | | Shikha Onirban was built to commemorate the valour and the sacrifices of [[Bangladesh Armed Forces]] Soldiers died in the [[Bangladesh Liberation War]] in 1971. |- | {{flag|Belgium}} | [[Congress Column]] in [[Brussels]] | [[File:Colonne du Congrès Bxl.02.JPG|100px]] | The Tomb of the Unknown Soldier at the base of the location. |- | {{flag|Bolivia}} | [[Monumento al Soldado Desconocido]] in [[La Paz]] | | The Tomb of the Unknown Soldier, center piece of the location.{{Citation needed|date=February 2011}} |- | rowspan=2 | {{flag|Brazil}} | [[Monument to the dead of World War II]], [[Flamengo Park]] in [[Rio de Janeiro]]. | [[File:Pracinhas-CCBY.jpg|100px]] | The Tomb of the Unknown Soldier on the monument's platform. |- | [[Brazilian Military Cemetery of Pistoia|Brazilian Monument and Tomb of the Unknown Soldier of World War II]], near [[Pistoia]], Italy. | [[File:Pistoia sacrario dell esercito brasiliano 4.jpg|100px]] | Votive Tomb of the Unknown Soldier, with monument pavilion. |- | rowspan=2 | {{flag|Bulgaria}} | [[Monument to the Unknown Soldier, Sofia|Monument to the Unknown Soldier]] in [[Sofia]] | [[File:Unknown-soldier-sofia-1.jpg|100px]] | |- | [[Monument to the Unknown Soldier, Haskovo|Monument to the Unknown Soldier]] in [[Haskovo]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://haskovo-online.com/content/view/12/8/lang,en/ |title=The Unknown Soldier Memorial in Haskovo}}</ref> | | |- | {{flag|Canada}} | [[Canadian Tomb of the Unknown Soldier|Tomb of the Unknown Soldier]] at the [[National War Memorial (Canada)|National War Memorial]], [[Confederation Square]] in [[Ottawa]] | [[File:Tomb of the Unknown Soldier - Tombe du Soldat inconnu.jpg|100px]] |<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ottawakiosk.com/panos/sparks_street_4.html |title=National War Memorial |publisher=ottawakiosk.com |accessdate=21 April 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090518005323/http://www.ottawakiosk.com/panos/sparks_street_4.html |archivedate=18 May 2009 |df=}}</ref> |- | rowspan=4 | {{flag|Chile}} | General [[Manuel Baquedano]] Square in [[Santiago]] | | Contains the remains of a soldier who died in 1881 during the [[War of the Pacific]].{{Citation needed|date=February 2011}} |- | [[Plaza de la Ciudadanía]] (Citizenship Square), Santiago | | Contains the remains of a soldier found in Perú.{{Citation needed|date=February 2011}} Died in 1881 during the [[War of the Pacific]]. |- | Cripta del [[Morro de Arica]] (Morro de Arica Crypt), [[Arica]] | | Contains the remains of a soldier found in 1998.{{Citation needed|date=February 2011}} Died during the [[War of the Pacific]]. |- | [[Unknown Sailor Monument]] | | A monument built in honor to the sailors that fought and died in the [[Battle of Iquique]], a naval battle off the coast of [[Chile]]. |- | {{flag|Czech Republic}} | [[National Monument in Vitkov|National Monument]] on [[Vítkov Hill]] in [[Prague]] | [[File:Praha, Vítkov, památník.JPG|100px]] | Contains remains of an unknown Czech soldier fallen at the [[Battle of Zborov (1917)|Battle of Zborov]] as well as an unknown Czechoslovak soldier fallen at the [[Battle of the Dukla Pass|Battle of Dukla]], a part of a larger memorial to all Czechoslovak soldiers. |- | {{flag|Dominican Republic}} | [[Flag Square of Santo Domingo]] | [[File:Arco de la plaza de la bandera.jpg|100px]] | The Arc of the Square contains the tomb of the soldier who died for the freedom of the Dominicans in the [[Dominican War of Independence]]. |- | rowspan=2 | {{flag|Egypt}} | [[Unknown Soldier Memorial (Egypt)|Unknown Soldier Memorial]] in [[Cairo]] | [[File:Nasrcity.jpg|100px]] | Also includes the tomb of President [[Anwar Sadat]]. |- | [[Alexandria Naval Unknown Soldier Memorial]] | [[File:Monument of the Navy Unknown Soldier in Alexandria (6).jpg|100px]] | |- | {{flag|Estonia}} | [[Defence Forces Cemetery of Tallinn|Defence Forces Cemetery]] in [[Tallinn]] | | |- | {{flag|Finland}} | [[Hietaniemi cemetery]] in [[Helsinki]] | [[File:Hietaniemi Cemetery (fi. Hietaniemen hautausmaa), Helsinki, Finland.jpg|100px]] | In the centre of the military cemetery are the tombs of the unknown soldier and Marshal [[Carl Gustaf Emil Mannerheim]]. |- | {{flag|France}} | [[Arc de Triomphe#Tomb of the Unknown Soldier|Tomb of the Unknown Soldier]] beneath the [[Arc de Triomphe]] de l'Étoile in [[Paris]] | [[File:Unknownsoldier paris.jpg|100px]] | |- | {{flag|Gambia}} | Tomb of the Unknown Soldier behind [[Arch 22]] in [[Banjul]] | [[File:Banjuljuly22b.JPG|100px]] | |- | {{flag|Germany}} | ''[[Unter den Linden]]'', [[Berlin]] | [[File:Berlin, Neue Wache, exterior view, may 2006.jpg|100px]] | Within a 19th-century guardhouse, the ''[[Neue Wache]]''. |- | {{flag|Greece}} | [[Tomb of the Unknown Soldier (Athens)|Tomb of the Unknown Soldier]] on [[Syntagma Square]] in [[Athens]] | [[File:EVZONES GROUP.JPG|100px]] | * Two quotations by [[Thucydides]], from [[Pericles' Funeral Oration]],<ref>{{cite book |title=Historiae in two volumes |last=Thucydides |author-link=Thucydides |publisher=Oxford University Press |place=Oxford |year=1942 |chapter=2.34.3 |url=http://www.perseus.tufts.edu/hopper/text?doc=Thuc.+2.34&fromdoc=Perseus%3Atext%3A1999.01.0199}} Available online at the [[Perseus Project]].</ref><ref>{{cite book |title=Historiae in two volumes |last=Thucydides |author-link=Thucydides |publisher=Oxford University Press |place=Oxford |year=1942 |chapter=2.43.3 |url=http://www.perseus.tufts.edu/hopper/text?doc=Perseus%3Atext%3A1999.01.0199%3Abook%3D2%3Achapter%3D43}} Available online at the [[Perseus Project]].</ref> are inscribed on the retaining wall: ''Μία κλίνη κενὴ φέρεται ἐστρωμένη τῶν ἀφανῶν'' ("... and one bed is carried empty, made for the unknown ones"), and ''Ἀνδρῶν ἐπιφανῶν πᾶσα γῆ τάφος'' ("The whole earth is the burial ground of famous men"). The inscriptions flank a central sculpture in low relief, depicting a dying [[hoplite]]. The names of battlefields where Greeks have fought since independence are inscribed on the monument. * The monument is guarded round the clock by the [[Evzones]] of the [[Presidential Guard (Greece)|Presidential Guard]]. |- | {{flag|Hungary}} | [[Hősök tere|Heroes' Square]] in [[Budapest]] | [[File:Heroes Square Budapest 2010 01.jpg|100px]] | |- | {{flag|India}} | [[Amar Jawan Jyoti]], [[New Delhi]] | [[File:Amar Jawan Jyoti.jpg|100px]] | Burning in a shrine under the arch of [[India Gate]] since 1971 is the Amar Jawan Jyoti (the flame of the immortal soldier) which marks the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier. The shrine itself is a black marble cenotaph with a rifle placed on its barrel, crested by a soldier's helmet. Each face of the cenotaph has inscribed in gold the words "Amar Jawan" (Immortal Warrior) in Hindi ([[Devanagari|Devanagri script]]). The Prime Minister of India pays homage to the country's fallen soldiers along with the Chiefs of Staff of each arm of the Armed Forces on each Republic Day of India. |- | {{flag|Indonesia}} | The Pandu war cemetery at [[Bandung]] | [[File:Kembangkuning.jpg|100px]] | The Field of Honor is a memorial to the unknown soldier. There is also the Tomb of the Unknown (Dutch) Sailor in Kembang Kuning war cemetery in [[Surabaya]].<ref>[http://www.ogs.nl/docs/NetherlandswarcemeteriesIndonesia.pdf "Netherlands war cemeteries in Indonesia", Netherlands War Graves Foundation]</ref> |- | rowspan="2" | {{flag|Iran}} | [[Chizar]], [[Tehran]] | [[File:Chizar tombs 01.jpg|100px]] | In Iran, unknown soldiers are buried in public places. Chizar is the largest of all. |- | [[Behesht Zahra]], [[Tehran]] | [[File:Unknown soldiers tomb in Behesht Zahra 01.jpg|100px]] | |- | {{flag|Iraq}} | [[The Monument to the Unknown Soldier]], in [[Grand Festivities Square]], Zawra Park, [[Baghdad]] | [[File:Baghdad-1174177 1920.jpg|100px]] | Three monuments in Zawra Park commemorate Iraq's fallen soldiers; The ''Monument to the Unknown Soldier'' (pictured), the ''[[Victory Arch]]'' (completed in 1989) and the ''[[Al-Shaheed Monument]]'' (also known as the Martyrs' Monument, completed in 1983). The ''Monument to the Unknown Soldier'' was constructed between 1979 and 1982, and replaced an earlier ''Unknown Soldier's Monument'' built in 1959 in a different location, but dismantled when the current monument was inaugurated. |- | {{flag|Israel}} | [[National Memorial Hall For Israel's Fallen]] in [[Mount Herzl]], [[Jerusalem]] | [[File:חניכת היכל הזכרון הממלכתי 1738.jpg|100px]] | the eternal flame monument to Unknown Soldiers. |- | {{flag|Italy}} | [[Piazza Venezia]] in [[Rome]] | [[File:Milite Ignoto in Altare della Patria in Vittoriano in Rome.jpg|100px]] | The Tomb of the ''Milite Ignoto'' in the ''[[Altare della Patria]]'' (Vittoriano). |- | rowspan=4 | {{flag|Japan}} | [[Chidorigafuchi National Cemetery]] in [[Tokyo]] | [[File:Chidorigafuchi04s3072.jpg|100px]] | |- | [[Ryozen Kannon]] in [[Kyoto]] | [[File:Ryozen Kannon Memorial to Unknown Soldier.jpg|100px]] | |- | ''[[Sekai Mumei Senshi no Haka|Tomb of the Unknown Soldier of the World]]'' in [[Ogose, Saitama]] | | |- | [[Dai Heiwa Kinen Tō]] in [[Tondabayashi, Osaka]] | [[File:Torre da Paz.jpg|100px]] | |- | {{flag|Jordan}} | Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in [[Amman]] | | Source: [https://www.flickr.com/photos/aladdinataha/13011821754/] |- | {{flag|Lebanon}} | [[Tomb of the Unknown Soldier (Lebanon)|Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in Lebanon]], [[Beirut]], Mathaf | | The Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in [[Lebanon]] represents the forming and independence of the [[Lebanese Armed Forces]] from the [[French Army]] in 1943.<ref name=":0">{{cite web |title=Lebanese Ground Forces |url=http://www.globalsecurity.org/military/world/lebanon/army.htm |publisher=GlobalSecurity.org |accessdate=8 December 2008}}</ref> The [[tomb]] also commemorates [[soldier]]s of the [[Legion of Orient]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.lebarmy.gov.lb/english/history.asp |title=LAF History |publisher=Lebanese Armed Forces |accessdate=19 May 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090501064935/http://lebarmy.gov.lb/English/History.asp |archivedate=1 May 2009 |df=}}</ref> and the [[Army of the Levant]] during the [[French Mandate for Syria and the Lebanon|French Mandate of Lebanon]] from 1920 to 1943.<ref name=":0" /> The cenotaph in the middle includes a ''[[Cedrus libani]]'' tree surrounded by a [[Laurus nobilis|laurel]]; the main symbol of [[List of Roman legions|Roman Legions]]. Around the cedar tree and laurel reads in [[Arabic]] : "Glory and Immortality for our Martyred Heroes". Behind the cenotaph are original [[List of Roman victory columns|Roman Columns]]. |- | {{flag|Lithuania}} | [[Vytautas the Great War Museum|Vienybės Square]] in [[Kaunas]] | [[File:Kaunas. Paminklas zuvusiems uz laisve. 2007-04-06.jpg|100px]] | Tomb of ''Nežinomas kareivis'', with remains of soldier who died in [[Lithuanian–Soviet War|fights against Bolsheviks]] in 1919. |- | {{flag|Malaysia}} | [[National Monument (Malaysia)|National Monument]] in [[Kuala Lumpur]] | [[File:Tugu negara.jpg|100px]] | Completed in 1966 to commemorate combatants who fought against [[Japanese occupation of Malaya, North Borneo and Sarawak|Japanese occupation of pre-independence Malaysia in World War II]] and the [[Malayan Races Liberation Army]] insurgency during the [[Malayan Emergency]]. Also includes a pre-independence [[cenotaph]], which was shifted from its original location closer to the old town of Kuala Lumpur, commemorating the war dead of World War I, World War II and the Malayan Emergency. |- | {{flag|Mauritius}} | Tomb of the Unknown Soldier in [[Curepipe]] |- | {{flag|Namibia}} | [[Heroes' Acre (Namibia)|Heroes' Acre]] in [[Windhoek]] | | The Tomb of the Unknown Soldier contains soil from [[Battle of Cassinga|Cassinga]] and Oshatotwa from the [[Namibian War of Independence]]. |- | {{flag|New Zealand}} | [[New Zealand Tomb of the Unknown Warrior|Tomb of the Unknown Warrior]], [[National War Memorial (New Zealand)|National War Memorial]] in [[Wellington]] | [[File:Tomb of the Unknown Warrior June 2012.JPG|100px]] | |- | {{flag|Peru}} | [[Plaza Bolivar (Lima)|Plaza Bolivar]] in [[Lima]] | [[File:Congreso del Perú.JPG|100px]] | Contains the remains of a soldier who died in 1881 during the [[War of the Pacific]]. |- | {{flag|Philippines}} | [[Heroes' Cemetery]] in [[Taguig]] | [[File:Libingan ng Mga Bayani.jpg|100px]] | Contains the remains of Filipino soldiers who have joined the military and served on the [[Philippine Revolution]], [[Philippine–American War]] and [[World War II]]. |- | {{flag|Poland}} | [[Tomb of the Unknown Soldier (Warsaw)|Tomb of the Unknown Soldier]], Marshall Józef Piłsudski Square in [[Warsaw]] | [[File:IWarszawajh1.jpg|100px]] | Constructed as the [[arcade (architecture)|arcade]] of [[Saxon Palace]], which was destroyed by the Germans in 1944. Contains the remains of a soldier who died between 1918 and 1920. |- | {{flag|Portugal}} | [[Tomb of the Unknown Soldier (Portugal)|Tomb of the Unknown Soldier]] in the [[Batalha Monastery]] | [[File:Chapter house of Mosteiro da Batalha (2).jpg|100px]] | |- | {{flag|Romania}} | [[Tomb of the Unknown Soldier (Romania)|Tomb of the Unknown Soldier]], [[Carol Park]] in [[Bucharest]] | [[File:RO B Tomb Unknown Soldier Bucharest.jpg|100px]] | |- | {{flag|Russia}} | [[Tomb of the Unknown Soldier (Moscow)|Tomb of the Unknown Soldier]], [[Alexander Garden]] in [[Moscow]] | [[File:Medvedev - Tomb of the Unknown Soldier.jpeg|100px]] | |- | {{flag|Serbia}} | [[Monument to the Unknown Hero]] on [[Avala|Mt. Avala]] near [[Belgrade]] | [[File:Monument to the Unknown Hero Avala1.jpg|100px]] | Memorial was built on the place where an unknown Serbian World War I soldier was buried. |- | {{flag|Slovenia}} | Monument to the Unknown [[France|French]] Soldier, [[French Revolution]] Square in [[Ljubljana]] | | |- | {{flag|Somalia}} | Tomb of the Unknown Soldier, [[Mogadishu]] | [[File:Somalia Tomb of the Unknown Soldier.jpg|100px]] | A monument erected in honour of the [[Somali Armed Forces|Somali men and women]] who died in defense of the [[Somali Republic]]. It's popularly known as ''Daljirka Dahsoon'', and it is an important landmark in Mogadishu. |- | rowspan = 2 | {{flag|Spain}} | [[Monumento a los Caidos por España (Madrid)|Monumento a los Caídos por España]], [[Plaza de la Lealtad]] in [[Madrid]] | [[File:Obelisco Dos de mayo (Madrid) 01.jpg|100px]] | Popularly known as the ''Obelisco'' ("[[Obelisk]]"), it is built on the same place where General [[Joachim Murat]] ordered the execution of numerous Spaniards after the [[Dos de Mayo Uprising]] of 1808. Originally inaugurated on 2 May 1840, it was re-inaugurated on 22 November 1985, by [[Juan Carlos I of Spain]] as a remembrance to all those who gave their life for Spain. An [[eternal flame]] fuelled by gas has been constantly burning on the front of the monument. |- | [[Fossar de les Moreres]], in [[Barcelona]] | [[File:Fossar de les Moreres.JPG|100px]] | The Fossar de les Moreres is a memorial plaza in [[Barcelona]] ([[Catalonia]], Spain), adjacent to the basilica of Santa Maria del Mar. The plaza was built over a cemetery where defenders of the city were buried following the [[Siege of Barcelona (1713–14)|Siege of Barcelona]] at the end of the [[War of the Spanish Succession]] in 1714. The plaza retains its everyday use as a public space, but also prominently features a memorial to the fallen Catalans of the war, with a torch of eternal flame and a heroic poem by Frederic Soler, "El Fossar de les Moreres". |- | {{flag|Syria}} | [[Tomb of the Unknown Soldier (Damascus)|Tomb of the Unknown Soldier]] in [[Damascus]] | | |- | {{flag|Turkey}} | [[Çanakkale Martyrs' Memorial]] on [[Gallipoli]] | [[File:Çanakkale Şehitleri Anıtı.JPG|100px]] | Erected for the unknown martyrs of the [[Çanakkale]] Front, which was the arena for the [[Battle of Gallipoli]] during [[World War I]]. Opened on 20 August 1960. Another monument{{which|date=December 2014}} at the same site is for the foreign soldiers (mostly{{citation needed|date=December 2014}} [[Australian and New Zealand Army Corps]]) lost in the same clash. |- | rowspan=2 | {{flag|Ukraine}} | Tomb of the Unknown Soldier, Dnieper Park in [[Kiev]]{{Citation needed|date=February 2011}} | [[File:Kiev's unknown soldier.jpg|100px]] | |- | [[Monument to the Unknown Sailor]], [[Shevchenko Park (Odessa)|Shevchenko Park]] in [[Odessa]] | [[File:Odessa Denkmal des unbekannten Matrosen.jpg|100px]] | |- | {{flag|United Kingdom}} | [[The Unknown Warrior|Tomb of the Unknown Warrior]], [[Westminster Abbey]] in [[London]] | [[File:Tomb of the Unknown Warrior - Westminster Abbey - London, England - 9 Nov. 2010.jpg|100px]] | |- | rowspan="5" | {{flag|United States}} | [[Tomb of the Unknown Soldier (Arlington)|Tomb of the Unknown Soldier]], [[Arlington National Cemetery]] in [[Arlington County, Virginia|Arlington, Virginia]] | [[File:Defense.gov photo essay 080614-A-0193C-015.jpg|100px]] | <ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.arlingtoncemetery.mil/Explore/Tomb-of-the-Unknown-Soldier |title=Tomb of the Unknown Soldier |publisher=[[Arlington National Cemetery]] |access-date=November 11, 2018 }}</ref>
|-
| [[Tomb of the Unknown Revolutionary War Soldier]], [[Washington Square (Philadelphia)|Washington Square]] in [[Philadelphia]] | [[File:Tomb of the Unknown Revolutionary War Soldier-27527.jpg|100px]] | |- | [[Tomb of the Unknown Soldier of the American Revolution]] | | |- | [[Civil War Unknowns Monument]], [[Arlington National Cemetery]] in [[Arlington, Virginia]] | [[File:Civil War Unknowns Memorial - E side - Arlington National Cemetery - 2011.JPG|100px]] | Contains the remains of 2,211 unknown Union and Confederate soldiers from Civil War battlefields. |- | [[Tomb of the Unknown Confederate Soldier]] at [[Beauvoir (Biloxi, Mississippi)|Beauvoir]] in [[Biloxi, Mississippi]] | [[File:Beauvoir Confederate States Unknown Soldier Tomb.jpg|100px]] |- | {{flag|Uzbekistan}} | [[Tomb of the Unknown Soldier (Tashkent)|Tomb of the Unknown Soldier]] on [[Mustaqillik Maydoni]] in [[Tashkent]] | [[File:Stamps of Uzbekistan, 2010-58.jpg|100px]] | Created in 1975, the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier is dedicated to the Uzbek soldiers who served in the [[Red Army]] during [[World War II]]. |- | {{flag|Venezuela}} | Tomb of the Unknown Soldier on Carabobo Field, [[Carabobo]] | [[File:Arco de Carabobo.JPG|100px]] | Contains the remains of a Venezuelan soldier who died in 1824 during the [[Battle of Ayacucho]]. |- | {{Flag|Vietnam}} | [[Vietnam War Memorial, Hanoi|Monument of Heroic Martyrs]] in [[Hanoi]] | | The monument to Heroic Martyrs is dedicated to the wounded and fallen soldiers who sacrificed their lives in the struggle for Vietnam national liberation, independence, freedom and the happiness of the people. |- | {{flag|Zimbabwe}} | Statue of the Unknown Soldier at the [[National Heroes Acre (Zimbabwe)|National Heroes Acre]], [[Harare]] | [[File:Heroes Acre Monument, Harare, Zimbabwe.jpg|100px]] | |}

page.title: Triple murder of Kurds activists in Paris

revision.text:
{{refimprove|date=January 2018}}
[[Fidan Doğan]], [[Sakine Cansiz|Sakine Cansız]] and [[Leyla Söylemez|Leyla Şaylemez]], Kurdish women activists, were murdered by gunshots to the head during the night from 9 to 10 January 2013 in [[Paris]] (10th arrondissement).<ref>[http://www.lemonde.fr/societe/article/2013/01/11/les-trois-militantes-kurdes-executees-a-paris-de-plusieurs-balles-dans-la-tete_1815662_3224.html] [[Le monde]] 2013</ref>
== Facts == During the night between Wednesday 9 and Thursday 10 January 2013, the bodies of Fidan Doğan, Sakine Cansız, co-founder of the [[Kurdistan Workers' Party]] (PKK) and Leyla Şaylemez – all three Kurdish women activists – were found in the premises of the Centre d'Information sur le Kurdistan located on 147 rue La Fayette in Paris. Each of them was shot execution-style with several bullets in the head.<ref name="lemonde">{{cite web|author=Avec [[Agence France-Presse|AFP]]|title=Les trois militantes kurdes ont été assassinées de plusieurs balles dans la tête|url=http://www.lemonde.fr/societe/article/2013/01/11/les-trois-militantes-kurdes-executees-a-paris-de-plusieurs-balles-dans-la-tete_1815662_3224.html|date=11 January 2013}}.</ref>
== Investigations == According to investigations by French authorities, it is possible that [[National Intelligence Organization (Turkey)|MİT]] (Turkey's National Intelligence Organization) is involved in the murders.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.lemonde.fr/police-justice/article/2015/07/23/assassinat-de-militantes-kurdes-a-paris-la-justice-pointe-l-implication-des-services-secrets-turcs_4694801_1653578.html|title=Assassinat de militantes kurdes à Paris : la justice souligne l’implication des services secrets turcs|date=23 July 2015|access-date=6 April 2016}}</ref> The suspected murderer, Ömer Güney, was a 34 year old Turkish maintenance employee at [[Charles de Gaulle Airport|Paris Charles de Gaulle]] airport. Video cameras at the site of the murder show that he was inside the building between 00:11 and 00:56 when the deaths occurred. Gunpowder was found on his bag. Technical investigations were performed on his Nokia mobile phone and experts decrypted it and restored deleted files. They found images taken the day before (January 8) establishing that he was in the premises of a Kurdish association in Villers-le-Bel between 4:23 and 5:33 in the morning and took pictures of 329 memberships files. Two days before, he took pictures of accounting tracing alleged racketeering activity inside the Kurdish community.<ref>http://www.lexpress.fr/actualite/societe/fait-divers/kurdes-assassinees-la-piste-politique_1312649.html</ref>
A few months after these murders, an audio recording between Ömer Güney and some members of MiT, and some notes were anonymously released on the Internet. Omer Güney also had hundreds of pictures of Kurdish activists in his mobile phone. Antiterrorist judge Jeanne Duyé was in charge of investigations; in September 2013, her computer was stolen from her home in a burglary. Ömer Güney was in jail from January 21, 2013.
The judge considered the involvement of Turkish secret services in the murder to be a possibility, but didn't establish who ordered the operation and if the murderer acted according to the will of the top management or not (in theory, this may have been an attempt to stall peace talks that were occurring between Ankara and the PKK at that time). On December 13, 2016, Ömer Güney was moved to a hospital for urgent care connected to his brain tumor and he died the next day, five weeks before the scheduled start of his trial.<ref>[http://www.20minutes.fr/societe/1982627-20161217-omer-gney-assassin-presume-trois-militantes-kurdes-paris-meurt-avant-proces « Omer Güney, assassin présumé de trois militantes kurdes à Paris, meurt avant son procès »], ''20minutes.fr'', accessed date 17 december 2016.</ref><ref>[http://www.leparisien.fr/faits-divers/militantes-kurdes-assassinees-a-paris-le-suspect-renvoye-devant-les-assises-13-08-2015-5008789.php],[[le parisien]] 13 August 2015</ref>
[[File:Fidan Doğan.png|thumb|Fidan Doğan in [[Strasbourg]] in 2012]]
Eyüp Doru, a representative of Turkish party [[Peoples' Democratic Party (Turkey)|HDP]] in Europe, stated that he suspects Fidan Doğan was the main target{{Citation needed|date=May 2017}} of the assassination. Lawyer Sylvie Boitel explained that this young woman was very clever and had three cultures: French, Turkish and Kurdish; one of her friends explained that she met French President [[François Hollande]] at least three times when he was leader of the [[Socialist Party (France)|Socialist Party]] and had active relationships with French authorities.{{Citation needed|date=May 2017}}
Metin, the brother of Sakine Cansiz, says that France is responsible because she was killed in France and the murderer died in jail before trial.<ref>[http://www.slate.fr/story/133979/guerre-de-lombre], [[Slate (magazine)|slate.fr]], on 11 January 2017</ref>
== Book == "Triple Assassinat au 147, Rue Lafayette" is a book by Laure Marchand, who spent three years investigating the murders and links with the Turkish secret services. It outlines the biographies of the three young women and discusses the politics of Turkish President [[Recep Tayyip Erdoğan]].<ref>[http://www.parismatch.com/Actu/International/Retour-sur-l-assassinat-de-trois-militantes-kurdes-a-Paris-1172876 parismatch.com//Retour-sur-l-assassinat-de-trois-militantes-kurdes-a-Paris-]</ref>
